item.title: Thomas Starzl, Trailblazer In Organ Transplantation, Dies At 90
item.description: March 5, 2017 - The doctor, who performed the world's first liver transplant surgery in 1963, eventually earned the moniker "father of transplantation."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 5, 2017 - The doctor, who performed the world's first liver transplant surgery in 1963, eventually earned the moniker "father of transplantation." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/05/518644481/thomas-starzl-trailblazer-in-organ-transplantation-dies-at-90

item.title: A Doctor On Why He Volunteered To Fight Ebola In Liberia
item.description: March 5, 2017 - In 2014, Dr. Steven Hatch traveled to Liberia to treat people infected with the Ebola virus. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with him about his new book, Inferno: A Doctor's Ebola Story.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 5, 2017 - In 2014, Dr. Steven Hatch traveled to Liberia to treat people infected with the Ebola virus. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with him about his new book, Inferno: A Doctor's Ebola Story. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/05/518606152/a-doctor-on-why-he-volunteered-to-fight-ebola-in-liberia

item.title: No One Was Prepared To Care For So Many Wounded In Mosul
item.description: March 5, 2017 - The number of wounded civilians and fighters is higher than expected in the battle to force ISIS from the Iraqi city. Care is coming from several sources, including U.S. forces.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 5, 2017 - The number of wounded civilians and fighters is higher than expected in the battle to force ISIS from the Iraqi city. Care is coming from several sources, including U.S. forces. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/05/518360464/no-one-was-prepared-to-care-for-so-many-wounded-in-mosul

item.title: Menstruation 101 For Boys: A Comic Book Is Their Guide
item.description: March 4, 2017 - It's two comic books in one: A guide for boys (so they won't tease girls) and advice for girls on how to handle their period.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 4, 2017 - It's two comic books in one: A guide for boys (so they won't tease girls) and advice for girls on how to handle their period. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/04/516628738/menstruation-101-for-boys-a-comic-book-is-their-guide

item.title: Doctor Launches Vision Quest To Help Astronauts' Eyeballs
item.description: March 4, 2017 - Scientists are learning that some astronauts' eyes change shape after time in space, leading to vision problems. But a sleep sack being developed might offer relief.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 4, 2017 - Scientists are learning that some astronauts' eyes change shape after time in space, leading to vision problems. But a sleep sack being developed might offer relief. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/04/518214299/doctor-launches-vision-quest-to-help-astronauts-eyeballs

item.title: Patients Demand The 'Right To Try' Experimental Drugs, But Costs Can Be Steep
item.description: March 3, 2017 - Terminally ill patients want easier access to candidate medicines still in the earliest stages of testing. While 33 states have passed laws to enable that, ethicists also warn of big risks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - Terminally ill patients want easier access to candidate medicines still in the earliest stages of testing. While 33 states have passed laws to enable that, ethicists also warn of big risks. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/03/517796956/patients-demand-the-right-to-try-experimental-drugs-but-costs-can-be-steep

item.title: Americans Conflicted Over GOP Plans To Dump Obamacare
item.description:
March 3, 2017 - Growing public support for the Affordable Care Act seems to be at odds with the GOP's plans to repeal and replace it.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/03/518204657/americans-conflicted-over-gop-plans-to-dump-obamacare
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - Growing public support for the Affordable Care Act seems to be at odds with the GOP's plans to repeal and replace it. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/03/518204657/americans-conflicted-over-gop-plans-to-dump-obamacare

item.title: POLL: More People Are Taking Opioids, Even As Their Concerns Rise
item.description: March 3, 2017 - The number of people who have used opioid painkillers is still rising, according to a new NPR-Truven Health Analytics poll. But they're also worried about addiction, overdose and side effects.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - The number of people who have used opioid painkillers is still rising, according to a new NPR-Truven Health Analytics poll. But they're also worried about addiction, overdose and side effects. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/03/518155165/poll-more-people-are-taking-opioids-even-as-their-concerns-rise

item.title: One Democrat's Hunt For The Hidden Obamacare Replacement Bill
item.description: March 2, 2017 - Republicans in Congress were invited Thursday to view a draft of the House bill aimed at repealing and replacing Obamacare. But Democrats who wanted a look came up empty in a game of "find the bill."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - Republicans in Congress were invited Thursday to view a draft of the House bill aimed at repealing and replacing Obamacare. But Democrats who wanted a look came up empty in a game of "find the bill." http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/02/518185329/one-democrats-hunt-for-the-hidden-obamacare-replacement-bill

item.title: $190 Million Raised To Fill Aid Gap Left By Trump's Abortion Rule
item.description: March 2, 2017 - When the president took action to block U.S. foreign aid funding of groups linked to abortion, a Dutch government official started fundraising.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - When the president took action to block U.S. foreign aid funding of groups linked to abortion, a Dutch government official started fundraising. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/02/517959453/-190-million-raised-to-fill-aid-gap-left-by-trumps-abortion-rule

item.title: Republican Hard-Liners Oppose Health Care Plan Led By Paul Ryan
item.description: March 2, 2017 - Some conservative members of Congress and activists who bedeviled GOP leadership during the Obama administration are back again in opposition to the health care plan led by House Speaker Paul Ryan.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - Some conservative members of Congress and activists who bedeviled GOP leadership during the Obama administration are back again in opposition to the health care plan led by House Speaker Paul Ryan. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/02/518197132/republican-hard-liners-oppose-health-care-plan-led-by-paul-ryan

item.title: Some Melanoma Survivors Are Still Getting Too Much Sun Exposure
item.description: March 2, 2017 - Getting people to change their health behaviors is hard. A cancer diagnosis may increase motivation to reduce risk, but it doesn't necessarily make the change easier.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - Getting people to change their health behaviors is hard. A cancer diagnosis may increase motivation to reduce risk, but it doesn't necessarily make the change easier. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/02/517967766/some-melanoma-survivors-are-still-getting-too-much-sun-exposure

item.title: Schumer Says GOP Division Gives Democrats A Chance To Save Obamacare
item.description: March 2, 2017 - As Republicans struggle to come up with an alternative they can pass, the Democratic leader in the Senate says odds are good Obamacare remains in place.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - As Republicans struggle to come up with an alternative they can pass, the Democratic leader in the Senate says odds are good Obamacare remains in place. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/02/518143202/schumer-says-gop-division-gives-democrats-a-chance-to-save-obamacare

item.title: Embryo Experiments Reveal Earliest Human Development, But Stir Ethical Debate
item.description: March 2, 2017 - Researchers who study developing human embryos have long limited their experimentation to lab embryos that are no more than 14 days into development. Some scientists are now pushing that boundary.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - Researchers who study developing human embryos have long limited their experimentation to lab embryos that are no more than 14 days into development. Some scientists are now pushing that boundary. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/02/516280895/embryo-experiments-reveal-earliest-human-development-but-stir-ethical-debate

item.title: Birth Control Is Working Better – Or At Least, It's Failing Less
item.description: March 1, 2017 - Failure rates for the most common forms of contraception are down, but it's not entirely clear whether it's due to education, availability, or other reasons.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - Failure rates for the most common forms of contraception are down, but it's not entirely clear whether it's due to education, availability, or other reasons. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/01/518000283/your-birth-control-is-working-better-or-at-least-failing-less
